questions.prompt: You receive the message: "Pilot boarding time changed to 0430 LT. Reduce speed to 8 knots and proceed to pilot station." What should you do first?

options.B: Reduce speed and adjust ETA to 0430 LT

questions.prompt: "Keep a sharp lookout and report any target CPA less than 1.0 NM." CPA means:

options.B: Closest Point of Approach

questions.prompt: "Prepare the mooring lines fore and aft, standby heaving lines." This instruction is about:

options.B: Berthing operations

questions.prompt: "Use appropriate PPE when handling chemicals." PPE stands for:

options.B: Port Pilot Escort

questions.prompt: "All crew must report to their muster stations with lifejackets." When is this order given?

options.B: During an emergency drill or real emergency

questions.prompt: "ETA revised to 1800 UTC. Maintain present course and speed." What action is required?

options.B: Continue as you are — no action needed

questions.prompt: A notice reads: "Entry to enclosed spaces only after atmosphere tested and permit issued." Before entering you must:

options.B: Ensure atmosphere testing is done and you have a valid permit

questions.prompt: "Vessels shall not exceed 6 knots in the port approach channel." This means:

options.A: You can go 6 knots or faster
options.B: Speed must be 6 knots or less

questions.prompt: Starboard is:

options.B: Right side of the vessel

questions.prompt: "Draft" refers to:

options.B: Depth of water below keel
options.C: Vertical distance from waterline to keel

questions.prompt: "Berth" is:

options.B: A place where a ship is moored in port

questions.prompt: "Muster station" is:

options.B: Emergency assembly area

questions.prompt: "Freeboard" means:

options.B: Distance from the waterline to the upper deck edge

questions.prompt: "Ballast" refers to:

options.B: Water taken aboard to maintain stability

questions.prompt: "Abeam" means:

options.B: At right angles to the vessel's centreline

questions.prompt: "Deadweight tonnage" (DWT) measures:

options.A: The weight of the empty vessel
options.B: The total weight a vessel can carry including cargo, fuel, crew, and stores
options.D: The volume of the cargo holds

questions.prompt: Choose the best sentence:

options.A: We must to check the lifeboat.
options.B: We must check the lifeboat.

questions.prompt: Incident report: "During cargo ops, the hose ____ and cargo spilled."

options.B: leaked

questions.prompt: Safety instruction: "You ____ smoke in the engine room."

options.B: mustn't

questions.prompt: Radio communication: "Standby on VHF channel 16." means:

options.B: Listen and be ready to respond on channel 16

questions.prompt: "If the engine ____ , we would have arrived on time."

options.B: hadn't broken down

questions.prompt: "The cargo ____ been discharged by the time the surveyor arrived."

options.B: had

questions.prompt: [VHF transcript] "All stations, all stations, all stations. This is Istanbul VTS. Bosphorus traffic one-way northbound until further notice. All southbound traffic anchor at designated area." What must southbound vessels do?

options.B: Anchor at the designated area

questions.prompt: [Bridge order] "Helmsman, port twenty. Steady on course 185." The helmsman should:

options.B: Turn port 20 degrees then steady on 185

questions.prompt: [VHF] "MV Deniz, MV Deniz. This is Mersin Port Control. Your berth is number 7. Pilot will board at fairway buoy at 1400 local." What information was given?

options.B: Berth number and pilot boarding location/time

questions.prompt: [Bridge order] "Dead slow ahead, standby anchor." This means the vessel is:

options.A: Leaving the anchorage at full speed
options.B: Moving very slowly and ready to drop anchor if needed

questions.prompt: [VHF] "Securité, securité, securité. Unlit barge adrift in position 40°50'N, 029°10'E. All vessels exercise caution." What type of warning is this?

options.B: Urgency — crew medical emergency

questions.prompt: [Bridge order] "Midships. Steady as she goes." The helmsman should:

options.B: Center the rudder and hold the current heading

questions.prompt: You are OOW and visibility suddenly drops to 0.5 NM in fog. Your immediate actions should include:

options.A: Maintain speed and course, it will clear soon
options.B: Reduce speed, sound fog signals, inform the master, plot radar targets
options.D: Call the engine room to shut down

questions.prompt: A crew member reports smelling smoke in the accommodation area. As the duty officer, you should first:

options.A: Wait to see if others also smell it
options.B: Investigate immediately and activate fire patrol, prepare to sound the alarm
options.C: Continue your watch and check later

questions.prompt: During mooring operations, the second line parts under tension. The correct response is:

options.B: Stop operations, clear the snap-back zone, assess the situation, report to the master
options.D: Speed up the operation to compensate

questions.prompt: You discover that a cargo tank vent has been left open during heavy rain. What is the primary concern?

options.B: Water contamination of cargo and potential stability issues

questions.prompt: A vessel on your starboard bow is on a steady bearing and decreasing range. According to COLREGs, you should:

options.A: Maintain course and speed — you are the stand-on vessel
options.B: Give way — alter course to starboard and pass astern

questions.prompt: The chief engineer reports that the main engine cooling water temperature is rising abnormally. As master, your first instruction should be:

options.A: Increase engine RPM to cool the system
options.B: Reduce speed, investigate the cause, and prepare contingency plans
options.C: Continue at full speed to reach port faster

questions.prompt: "SMCP" stands for:

options.B: Standard Marine Communication Phrases

questions.prompt: "Bunkering" means:

options.B: Taking on fuel for the vessel

questions.prompt: "Trim" of a vessel refers to:

options.A: The paint condition of the hull
options.B: The difference between forward and aft drafts
options.C: The number of crew on board

questions.prompt: "ISM Code" is related to:

options.B: International Safety Management of ships

questions.prompt: "Inert gas system" is used to:

options.B: Replace oxygen in cargo tanks to prevent explosion

questions.prompt: "Fender" on a vessel is used for:

options.B: Protecting the hull during berthing

questions.prompt: "ECDIS" stands for:

options.B: Electronic Chart Display and Information System

questions.prompt: "Hawser" is a:

options.B: Large mooring or towing rope

questions.prompt: The correct SMCP phrase when you do not understand a message is:

options.B: "Say again" (followed by the part not understood)

questions.prompt: "PAN PAN" is used for:

options.A: Immediate danger to life or vessel
options.B: Urgent situation requiring assistance but no immediate danger to life

questions.prompt: During a fire drill, the phrase "Fire, fire, fire! Fire in the engine room!" should be announced on:

options.B: The ship's general alarm followed by PA announcement

questions.prompt: "Man overboard! Starboard side!" — After hearing this, the helmsman should:

options.B: Put the helm hard to starboard (Williamson turn) and throw lifebuoy

questions.prompt: In SMCP, "I say again" is used when:

options.A: You didn't hear the other station
options.B: You are repeating your own important message for clarity
options.C: You want to end the conversation

questions.prompt: The emergency signal for abandon ship is:

options.B: Seven short blasts followed by one long blast on the ship's whistle
options.D: Continuous sounding of the fog horn

writing_prompt.prompt: Describe your last vessel and your main duties in English. Include: vessel type, trading area, and one safety responsibility.

task_completion.description: Addressed all parts of the prompt
